item.title: About Me
item.description: Education Undergraduate student @ Stony Brook University studying Computer Science and Applied Mathematics (Expected Graduation: May 2021) Work Experience Incoming Software Engineer @ Microsoft (Summer 2021) Software Engineer Intern @ Microsoft (Summer 2020) Undergraduate Research Assistant @ The Moffitt Group in Stony Brook University Bioinformatics Department (Fall 2019 - Present) Undergraduate Research Assistant @ The Eisele Group in The City College of New York (Summer 2017 - Winter 2018)

item.title: Hugo site on Github with domain from Namecheap
item.description: A personal website to showcase personal projects is one of the most important things a computer science student should have when they are searching for a job. This tutorial will serve all those students that are not well-versed in web development and want an easy way to set up their website in a fast manner. Before Starting With this tutorial I’m assuming you have an IDE such as VS Code or Sublime and a version control system such as Git.
